intro: Xylophacos lectulus, commonly known as the slender wood-fern, is a member of the family Hymenophyllaceae. It is a small, epiphytic fern that typically grows on tree trunks or branches in moist, shaded environments. The plant has delicate, lance-shaped fronds that are often covered in a fine layer of trichomes. Its reproductive structures, known as sori, are arranged in lines along the margins of the fronds. Xylophacos lectulus is characterized by its unique morphology and is found in tropical and subtropical regions.
